intro: Haloragis uncatipila, commonly known as the slender waterwheel plant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its aquatic or semi-aquatic habitat, typically found in still or slow-moving freshwater environments. The plant has opposite, narrow leaves that are often submerged or floating, and it produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in whorls. It is a member of the Haloragaceae family, which includes other aquatic and wetland plants. Haloragis uncatipila is often used in water gardens and wetland restoration projects due to its aesthetic and ecological benefits.
